name: Meta Prompt Engineering Evaluator
description: Evaluate engineered prompts for clarity, structure, constraints, and reliability. Assess whether prompts will produce consistent, high-quality outputs that meet specified requirements.

criteria.name: Role Definition
criteria.description: Evaluates clarity and appropriateness of role/persona specification

1.label: No role specified
1.description: Prompt lacks any role, persona, or expertise definition. Output perspective is unclear.

2.label: Vague role
2.description: Generic role mentioned ('expert', 'assistant') without domain specificity or expertise detail.

3.label: Basic role
3.description: Role specified with domain (e.g., 'software engineer') but lacks expertise level, audience, or priorities.

4.label: Clear role
4.description: Specific role with expertise and audience defined (e.g., 'Senior security architect for healthcare systems'). Priorities implicit.

5.label: Comprehensive role
5.description: Detailed role with expertise, audience, and explicit priorities/values. Role directly shapes output quality (e.g., 'Senior security architect for healthcare systems prioritizing HIPAA compliance and patient data protection').

criteria.name: Task Decomposition
criteria.description: Evaluates how well complex tasks are broken into clear, actionable steps

1.label: No structure
1.description: Single undifferentiated instruction. No breakdown or sequence.

2.label: Minimal structure
2.description: Vague steps without clear sequence or deliverables (e.g., 'analyze then recommend').

3.label: Basic steps
3.description: 3-7 numbered steps with action verbs, but deliverables or success criteria unclear.

4.label: Clear steps
4.description: 3-7 numbered steps with clear deliverables for each. Sequence logical, dependencies apparent.

5.label: Detailed decomposition
5.description: 3-7 numbered steps with explicit deliverables, success criteria, and expected format. Follows appropriate pattern (sequential/parallel/iterative).

criteria.name: Constraint Specificity
criteria.description: Evaluates how explicitly format, length, tone, and content requirements are stated

1.label: No constraints
1.description: No format, length, tone, or content requirements specified. Output unpredictable.

2.label: Vague constraints
2.description: Generic requirements ('be professional', 'not too long') without measurable criteria.

3.label: Some constraints
3.description: 2-3 constraint types specified (e.g., length + tone) but lack precision (e.g., 'approximately 500 words').

4.label: Clear constraints
4.description: Format, length, tone, and content constraints specified with measurable criteria (e.g., '500-750 words, professional tone for executives, must include 3 examples').

5.label: Comprehensive constraints
5.description: All relevant constraints explicitly defined: format (structure), length (ranges per section), tone (audience-specific), content (must include/avoid lists). Constraints prevent known failure modes.

criteria.name: Output Format Clarity
criteria.description: Evaluates how clearly the expected output structure is specified

1.label: No format specified
1.description: Output structure completely undefined. Could be paragraph, list, JSON, etc.

2.label: Format mentioned
2.description: Format type mentioned (e.g., 'JSON', 'markdown') but structure not defined.

3.label: Basic structure
3.description: High-level sections defined (e.g., 'Introduction, Body, Conclusion') without detailed format.

4.label: Clear structure
4.description: Explicit structure with section names and content types (e.g., '## Analysis (2-3 paragraphs), ## Recommendations (bulleted list)').

5.label: Template provided
5.description: Complete output template or example showing exact structure, formatting, and content expectations. Easy to pattern-match.

criteria.name: Quality Checks
criteria.description: Evaluates self-evaluation criteria and verification mechanisms

1.label: No quality checks
1.description: No verification, validation, or self-evaluation criteria included.

2.label: Generic checks
2.description: Vague quality requirements ('ensure quality', 'check for errors') without specific criteria.

3.label: Basic checklist
3.description: 3-5 checkable items but criteria subjective or unmeasurable (e.g., 'Output is good quality').

4.label: Specific checks
4.description: 3-5 specific, measurable checks with verification methods (e.g., 'Word count 500-750: count words').

5.label: Comprehensive verification
5.description: 3-5 specific checks with test methods AND fix instructions. Checks prevent known failure modes (hallucination, bias, format errors). Includes revision requirement if checks fail.

criteria.name: Consistency & Testability
criteria.description: Evaluates whether prompt design supports reliable, repeatable outputs

1.label: Highly variable
1.description: Underspecified prompt will produce inconsistent outputs across runs. No testing consideration.

2.label: Somewhat variable
2.description: Some structure but missing key constraints. Likely 40-60% consistency across runs.

3.label: Moderately consistent
3.description: Structure and constraints should produce ~60-80% consistency. Not explicitly tested.

4.label: High consistency expected
4.description: Clear structure, constraints, and format should produce >80% consistency. Testing protocol mentioned.

5.label: Validated consistency
5.description: Prompt explicitly tested 5-10 times with documented consistency metrics (length variance, format compliance, quality ratings). Refined based on failure patterns.

criteria.name: Failure Mode Prevention
criteria.description: Evaluates whether prompt addresses common failure modes

1.label: No prevention
1.description: Prompt vulnerable to common issues: hallucination, bias, unsafe content, format inconsistency.

2.label: Minimal prevention
2.description: One failure mode addressed (e.g., 'avoid bias') but without specific mechanism.

3.label: Some prevention
3.description: 2-3 failure modes addressed with general instructions (e.g., 'cite sources', 'be unbiased').

4.label: Good prevention
4.description: 3-4 failure modes explicitly prevented with specific mechanisms (e.g., 'If uncertain, say I don't know', 'Include citations in (Author, Year) format').

5.label: Comprehensive prevention
5.description: All relevant failure modes addressed: hallucination (uncertainty expression), bias (multiple perspectives), unsafe content (explicit prohibitions), inconsistency (format template). Mechanisms are specific and verifiable.

criteria.name: Overall Completeness
criteria.description: Evaluates whether all necessary components are present and integrated

1.label: Incomplete
1.description: Missing 3+ major components (role, steps, constraints, format, checks).

2.label: Partially complete
2.description: Missing 2 major components or multiple components are underdeveloped.

3.label: Mostly complete
3.description: All major components present but 1-2 need more detail. Components not well-integrated.

4.label: Complete
4.description: All major components (role, task steps, constraints, format, quality checks) present with adequate detail. Good integration.

5.label: Comprehensive
5.description: All components present with excellent detail and integration. Includes examples, edge case handling, and testing validation. Ready for production use.

code_generation.focus: Emphasize error handling, test coverage, security constraints, and style guide compliance in quality checks.
code_generation.common_issues: Missing edge case requirements, no security vulnerability checks, unclear testing expectations

content_writing.focus: Emphasize tone/audience definition, length constraints, structural requirements (hook/body/conclusion), and SEO if relevant.
content_writing.common_issues: Vague audience definition, no length limits, missing content requirements (examples, citations)

data_analysis.focus: Emphasize methodology specification, visualization requirements, statistical rigor, and actionable insights.
data_analysis.common_issues: No statistical significance criteria, unclear visualization expectations, missing business context

creative_tasks.focus: Balance specificity with creative freedom. Use few-shot examples. Emphasize style and tone over rigid structure.
creative_tasks.common_issues: Over-specification killing creativity, no style examples, missing target audience

research_synthesis.focus: Emphasize source quality, citation format, claim verification, and uncertainty expression.
research_synthesis.common_issues: No anti-hallucination checks, missing citation requirements, unclear evidence standards

simple_tasks.recommendation: Focus on output format and 1-2 key quality checks. Role may be optional. Target score: ≥3.5

moderate_tasks.recommendation: Include role, numbered steps, format template, and 3-4 quality checks. Target score: ≥4.0

complex_tasks.threshold: 5+ steps, high ambiguity, multi-dimensional outputs, critical use case
complex_tasks.recommendation: Full template with role/priorities, detailed decomposition, comprehensive constraints, 5+ quality checks, examples, testing protocol. Target score: ≥4.5

common_failure_modes.inconsistent_outputs: Missing output format template or underspecified constraints. Add explicit structure.
common_failure_modes.wrong_length: No length constraints or ranges too vague. Specify min-max per section.
common_failure_modes.wrong_tone: Audience not defined or tone not specified. Add target audience and formality level.
common_failure_modes.hallucination: No uncertainty expression required. Add 'If uncertain, say so' and fact-checking requirements.
common_failure_modes.missing_information: Required elements not explicit. List 'Must include: [elements]'.
common_failure_modes.poor_reasoning: No intermediate steps required. Add chain-of-thought or show-work requirement.

excellence_indicators: Prompt has been tested 5-10 times with documented consistency >80%
Quality checks directly address known failure modes from testing
Output format includes complete template or detailed example
Task decomposition follows appropriate pattern (sequential/parallel/iterative) for the problem type
Constraints are balanced (specific where needed, flexible where appropriate)
Role and priorities are tailored to specific domain and audience
Examples provided for complex or nuanced output formats
Refinement history shows iteration based on actual failures

evaluation_notes.scoring: Calculate weighted average across all criteria. Minimum passing score: 3.0 (basic quality). Production-ready target: 4.0+. Excellence threshold: 4.5+.
evaluation_notes.context: Adjust expectations based on prompt complexity and use case criticality. Simple one-off prompts may score 3.5-4.0 and be adequate. Production prompts for critical systems should target 4.5+.
evaluation_notes.iteration: Low scores indicate specific areas for refinement. Focus on lowest-scoring criteria first. Retest after changes.
